website_summaries.verdict: Although some people will love its design and simplicity, the Bose Acoustic Wave Music System II doesn't offer the sound quality or features of its competitors--and it's way more expensive.
pros: convenient handles for transporting the system from room to room
decent sound quality on light classical and acoustic music
achieves high volume without sound breaking up
cons: LCD display on top (you can't see it from across the room)
performance doesn't live up to the price

customer_reviews.title: A good choice used
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an older (1996) used version because the newer versions are so blame expensive. This older version does not have a deck for tapes and it does not have a turntable input. However, the sound quality is really excellent and probably has not been improved much in subsequent years. It is a very simply machine with almost no "foo-foo" and if you're looking for a single piece to fill a mid-sized room with a sound quality almost as good as a separate stereo setup, this is for you,
customer_reviews.author: John E. Mack

customer_reviews.title: VERY PLEASED!!
customer_reviews.text: VERY PLEASED!!! Received two Wave Systems and so very "Happy"! Considering ordering another as the Quality of Sound is better than the Newer Units from Bose!!! Arrived in great condition and on time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: The beautiful sound and multiple usage. It is our home sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin H. Heuer

customer_reviews.title: Love the unit
customer_reviews.text: Love the unit, but was disappointed that I had to go to other suppliers for miscellaneous parts (power pack, rca plugs, wires and carrying case). Not a one stop shop!
customer_reviews.author: David Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Older than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this system used. Everthing still works, but for $385, I expected it to be newer. The label in the back indicates that it was made in 1997. The box is no longer white, but yellowish. After overcoming the initial disappointment, I am beginng to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Shun998

customer_reviews.title: Compact system with huge sound
customer_reviews.text: ''Extraordinary sound without being a nuisance to your neighbors'' is my verdict for this system and with the Bluetooth adapter, I can listen to music from all my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest M. Yelibora

customer_reviews.title: FiveStars
customer_reviews.text: We like it very much. Such a great sound , second to no one. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: VINCENT D'ERAMO

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Bose
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Excellent customer service. Outstanding product. My husband loves his Bose!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Works great for vinyl
customer_reviews.text: I mainly play vinyl through mine. If combined with a quality record player and a Gardo cartridge you can get some amazing sound. The bass is smooth sounding but I would like a slight bit more on certain songs. I would have also liked more inputs/outputs etc for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Psysouth

customer_reviews.title: at best, a $500 unit
customer_reviews.text: Bose decides what frequencies you want to hear and thus you cannot change the frequencies. I could live with that, but after making this unit for decades, the price does not reflect the advances in technology and the decrease in price of same. This is, at best, a $500 unit. But Bose will maintain their price at all "cost". Good sound, but outdated, and over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: Great player
customer_reviews.text: I've had this system for a couple of years, and it has consistently been a nice addition to my home. CD's have a nice surround effect, which is great for a small, portable player. I can hear individual vocals and instruments distinctly. One negative... I would love for it to have backup battery capability. I needed to bring it to an outdoor event, and I couldn't without first hooking it up to a generator. Other than that, this is a sound (ha ha) investment.
customer_reviews.author: crazydaisy

customer_reviews.title: for a very large room
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 3 years ago, I like classical music. This has an exellent sound for its small body when you play it very loud. For our 1500 square foot condo, this is away too much. I regret I didn't buy the wave 1..... Now, bose has many features to accomodate the trends, please check their HP to learn before you order at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Lousy sound quality for way too much money
customer_reviews.text: For $1000 you can get much, much better sound. Heck, you can get something better for $200. Poor quality construction, boomy, dull sound with no real highs and one-note bass. Might sound good if you've never heard anything else, but really, a lousy, overpriced hunk of junk. There's a reason that the Bose display in most brick-and-mortar stores is separated from the rest of the other companies - Bose insists on that, so that people can't make an honest comparison with other products. They know that if people get to hear other systems, they'd never buy the Bose product. Bose represents the triumph of marketing over engineering and construction quality. Don't waste your money. Former Bose owner....
customer_reviews.author: Dan Randon

product_meta.title: Bose Acoustic Wave Music System II - Platinum White
product_meta.description: Our best all-in-one music system is now even better. The Acoustic Wave music system ll offers more lifelike sound for larger spaces, with improved functionality and versatility, yet remains refreshingly simple to use. Acclaimed waveguide speaker technology still lies at the heart of this system's performance, so it rivals the sound of much larger, more complicated stereos. An all-new Bose digital platform fine tunes the sound for more accurate, consistent music reproduction—even at louder volume levels. Vocals sound cleaner. Instruments ring truer. The result comes closer to music in a natural, live-performance setting. The Acoustic Wave music system ll plays your home-burned CDs as well as regular discs and AM/FM radio. You'll find a new headphone jack for private listening, auxiliary inputs and an updated informational display. A variety of accessories adds to your listening enjoyment at home or on the go. And you can add our optional 5-CD changer for even more continuous listening. The system hasn't changed in size or convenience. It still fits almost anywhere in your home, easily controlled from across the room by a credit card-sized remote. It accomodates your MP3 player, travels easily and goes portable with the optional power pack. The original Acoustic Wave music system changed opinions of what a quality stereo system could be. Now, the Acoustic Wave music system ll challenges our perceptions once again, with sound that comes even closer to the essence of live performance.
feature_bullets: Our versatile, all-in-one music system now delivers smoother, more lifelike sound even at loud volumes
Ideal for large rooms and outdoor spaces
Available accessories for multimedia expansion and portability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars25 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
